alert.note: Alert for Hansford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 1:58PM CDT until June 05 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. For the Palo Duro Creek...including Spearman 6W...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W. * WHEN...Until Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The creek is at bankfull stage. Some minor overbank flooding occurs and cattle in the floodplain may be threatened. At 12.0 feet, Moderate overbank flooding occurs. Cattle are threatened and damage to fences is possible * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 6.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 10.8 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall to 5.8 feet Monday morning. It will rise to 7.2 feet early Monday afternoon. It will then fall to 4.2 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then rise again but remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 200 AM CDT.
